title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6500.6 - Award amount and schedule of reduction
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6500.6 - Award amount and schedule of reduction

State Regulations
(a) The executive director in consultation
with the advisory council will determine the types of projects to be funded
from the allocation for each fiscal year based on factors which shall include, but need not be limited to: (1)
consistency
with the requirements and intent of the Jobs Two Thousand for New York State
(J2K) Act; (2)
demand as evidenced
by the number and type of applications previously received for this and other
programs administered by NYSTAR; and
(3)
public comments and requests received by
NYSTAR or other appropriate evidence of need. (b) Consistent with the number of
applications and the funds appropriated, the executive director in consultation
with the advisory council may limit the maximum amount of State assistance
available for any project. (c) The

Faculty Development Program is intended to provide interim State assistance to
generate long-term commitment by the award recipient to the funded
entrepreneurial research endeavor. Accordingly, the proportion of State
assistance to the total cost of the proposal decreases relative to the
increased financial responsibility borne by the award recipient as reflected in
the required increase in match set forth in section
6500.5
of this Part. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
6500.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
